definition: a flood of tears and mucus/broken-hearted and weeping bitterly

sentences.english: It was raining cats and dogs outside, so we had to stay at home.
sentences.chinese: 外面大雨滂沱，我们只好呆在家里。

sentences.english: KN-2 is running at circle line of Chi-Chi Town, Nan-Tou County.
sentences.chinese: 滂沱大雨中行驶于集集环镇铁路的庆仁2号蒸气机车。

sentences.english: The rain drove across the windshield in sheets .
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱击打着挡风玻璃。
傍晚时，突然下起滂沱大雨。
要么在三更半夜时，要么在大雨滂沱中。

sentences.english: Above was an angry sky, from which rain fell and in which lightning played.
sentences.chinese: 大山之上是怒吼的天空，大雨滂沱，雷电肆虐。

sentences.english: The heavy rain had turned the pitch into a quagmire.
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱，球场变成了泥沼。

sentences.english: The heavy rain made us stray.
sentences.chinese: 滂沱大雨迫使我们绕道而行。

sentences.english: The last two days of her stay there it rained like fury.
sentences.chinese: 她在那儿逗留的最后两天里大雨滂沱。

sentences.english: In the middle of the picnic, it started to rain buckets and everybody got soaked.
sentences.chinese: 野餐时突然大雨滂沱，人人淋得像落汤鸡一样。

sentences.english: Dakar is most affected, due to the unusually heavy rains.
sentences.chinese: 达喀尔由于异乎寻常的滂沱大雨受影响最严重。

sentences.english: Wang Shutong says good - bye come out , meeting torrential heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 王树彤告辞出来，正遇上滂沱大雨。

sentences.english: We had a heavy rain last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜下了一场滂沱大雨。

sentences.english: It rained heavily, causing severe flooding in that place.
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱，造成了那个地方洪水泛滥。

sentences.english: The crops were drowned by the heavy rainfall.
sentences.chinese: 庄稼被滂沱大雨浸没了。

sentences.english: It rained heavily, causing great damage.
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱，造成了很大损害。

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
